elements.name: panel1
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "Obtaining information".

elements.name: question1
elements.title: Market research collects information. The retail company needs this information in order to make decisions. From which areas is information collected?
elements.correctAnswer: Customers, own retail business, competition and market environment

elements.name: question2
elements.title: According to which two types of research can market research methods be divided?
elements.correctAnswer: Primary research (field research) and secondary research (desk research)

elements.name: question3
elements.title: Which market research methods can be used to collect your own new data material?
elements.correctAnswer: Observation, survey (personal interview, written survey, panel), market test or experiment

elements.name: panel2
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "Obtaining information".

elements.name: question4
elements.title: What can't you find out by observing?
elements.correctAnswer: The buying motives of customers cannot be observed.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: Which three internal sources for existing figures do you know?
elements.correctAnswer: Sales statistics and turnover figures; planning documents; accounting; reports on various observations; previous market research results; key figures

elements.name: question6
elements.title: What do you need to consider in market research before you start collecting new data?
elements.correctAnswer: Primary research is expensive, so secondary research should always be carried out first in order to make use of existing information. The selection and timing of the sample is very important in primary research; the quality of the data and results obtained depends on this.

elements.name: panel3
elements.title: Answer the following questions about the factual text "Obtaining information".

elements.name: question7
elements.title: Which market research method is suitable for clarifying whether the promotional items are in the most frequented places in your business?
elements.correctAnswer: Observation of the flow of customers in the store by staff and with the help of cameras.
